Articles.Content:
Hello,

Please can somebody recomend a good moon or planet to test a rovers capabilitys out. The Moon is getting boring with its smooth hills and bumps. I want to test the limits of grip, maneuverability and power, Steep hills and uneven terrain that will test individual suspension.

Thank you in advance.

Edited July 11, 2013 by Epic DaVinci
Try Minmus: It's not much harder to get to Delta-v wise, and the low gravity and steep hills make it more of a challenge to drive on.
I find bouncing around on the spaceport is a good way to see if something will flip...
Yeah, i currently use the space port rocket launching pad for jumping off at speed to test for strength, but there are no steep hills to test traction and braking.

If you're up for a bit of a drive or can handle a short "hop", there's some pretty good sized mountains about 80 kilometers to the west of KSC...I land in them frequently when I'm trying to eyeball a KSC landing. You'd probably pick up their foothills awful fast.
ahh ok, thankyou for the help, ill check these locations out.

how do i change to answered?

Edit the OP and change the drop-down.

Done, thankyou.

Edited July 11, 2013 by Epic DaVinci
